org.eclipselabs.emongo.junit.util

Class MongoDatabaseLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.rules.ExternalResource
      • org.eclipselabs.eunit.junit.utils.ServiceLocator<T>
        • org.eclipselabs.eunit.junit.utils.ServiceConfigurator<MongoProvider>
          • org.eclipselabs.emongo.junit.util.MongoDatabaseLocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.junit.rules.TestRule

    public class MongoDatabaseLocator
extends org.eclipselabs.eunit.junit.utils.ServiceConfigurator<MongoProvider>
    This class is intended to be used as a JUnit @Rule. It will verify that the IMongoDB service exists, and it will delete all collections in the specified database after each test runs. Example usage: 

     @Rule
 public MongoDatabase database = new MongoDatabase();
    Author:
    bhunt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MongoDatabaseLocator()
      Connects to the "junit" database on localhost:27017
      MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String database)
      Connects to the specified database on localhost:27017 and defaults to dropping the database before each test
      MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname, int port, java.lang.String database, java.lang.String clientId)
      Connects to the specified database on the specified host and port and defaults to dropping the database before each test
      MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname, int port, java.lang.String database, java.lang.String clientId, boolean dropDatabaseBefore, boolean dropDatabaseAfter)
      Connects to the specified database on the specified host and port
      MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname, java.lang.String database)
      Connects to the specified database on the specified host using the default port 27017 and defaults to dropping the database before each test

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.net.URI createCollectionURI(java.lang.String collection)
      Creates a URI for accessing a collection using the database connection as a base URI and appending the collection as the next segment.
      java.net.URI createObjectURI(java.lang.String collection, java.lang.String id)
      Creates a URI for accessing an object using the database connection as a base URI and appending the collection and object id as the next segments.
      com.mongodb.client.MongoDatabase getDatabase()
      Provides access to the MongoDB driver for the database this instance is connected to.

      • MongoDatabaseLocator

        public MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String database)
        Connects to the specified database on localhost:27017 and defaults to dropping the database before each test
        Parameters:
        database - the name of the database to use for unit testing

      • MongoDatabaseLocator

        public MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname,
                            java.lang.String database)
        Connects to the specified database on the specified host using the default port 27017 and defaults to dropping the database before each test
        Parameters:
        hostname - the host running MongoDB
        database - the name of the database to use for unit testing

      • MongoDatabaseLocator

        public MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname,
                            int port,
                            java.lang.String database,
                            java.lang.String clientId)
        Connects to the specified database on the specified host and port and defaults to dropping the database before each test
        Parameters:
        hostname - the host running MongoDB
        port - the port MongoDB is listening on
        database - the name of the database to use for unit testing
        alias - the alias configured on the MongoDB provider service

      • MongoDatabaseLocator

        public MongoDatabaseLocator(java.lang.String hostname,
                            int port,
                            java.lang.String database,
                            java.lang.String clientId,
                            boolean dropDatabaseBefore,
                            boolean dropDatabaseAfter)
        Connects to the specified database on the specified host and port
        Parameters:
        hostname - the host running MongoDB
        port - the port MongoDB is listening on
        database - the name of the database to use for unit testing
        alias - the alias configured on the MongoDB provider service
        dropDatabaseBefore - set to true if you want the database dropped before each test; false otherwise
        dropDatabaseAfter - set to true if you want the database dropped after each test; false otherwise
